intro: Allantodia multicaudata, commonly known as the many-tailed allantodia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It features a basal rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, terminal spikes. Its flowering period typically occurs during the spring and early summer months. Allantodia multicaudata is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
